dateline.placeName: PeschierePalazzo Peschiere, Genoa. The Dickens family moved in around 23 Sep 1844, returning periodically while travelling around Italy (returning on 20 Dec 1844 and 9 Apr 1845); the family left Genoa on 9 June.

body.p: Do me the favor to accept the accompanying little book.The Chimes. This letter accompanied a presentation copy, inscribed "Mrs: Curry | From | Charles Dickens | Genoa. Twelfth April 1845". It is a very poor mark of my sincere and cordial regard; but I would live in your recollection sometimes after leaving here: and it may serve, perhaps, as a help to your remembrance, for want of a better.
